Assignment 2

library(haven) TEDS_2016<- read_stata(“https://github.com/datageneration/home/blob/master/DataProgramming/data/TEDS_2016.dta?raw=true”)

TEDS_2016\(PartyID <- factor(TEDS_2016\)PartyID, labels=c(“KMT”,“DPP”,“NP”,“PFP”, “TSU”, “NPP”,“NA”))

attach(TEDS_2016) head(PartyID) tail(PartyID)

library(descr) freq(TEDS_2016$PartyID)

library(tidyverse) library(dplyr)

T2 <- TEDS_2016 %>% count(PartyID) %>% # Count occurrences of each PartyID mutate(perc = n / nrow(TEDS_2016)) # Calculate percentage

ggplot(T2, aes(x = reorder(PartyID, -perc), y = perc, fill = PartyID)) + geom_bar(stat = “identity”) + ylab(“Party Support (%)”) + xlab(“Taiwan Political Parties”) + theme_bw() + scale_fill_manual(values = c(“steelblue”, “forestgreen”, “khaki1”, “orange”, “goldenrod”, “yellow”, “grey”))

Problems Encountered

Dealing With Missing Values

Exploring the relationship with Tondu

library(ggcorrplot)

Select the relevant columns for correlation

library(dplyr)

Create the ‘female’ variable (1 if sex == 2, otherwise 0)

TEDS_2016 <- TEDS_2016 %>% mutate(female = ifelse(Sex == 2, 1, 0))

table(TEDS_2016$female) # Check the output

Check if the variable is created correctly

cor_vars<- TEDS_2016 %>% select(Tondu, female, age, DPP, income, edu, Taiwanese, Econ_worse)

Compute correlation matrix

Nitxnfub0@$ # Print correlation matrix print(cor_matrix)

Visualize correlation matrix with ggcorrplot

cor_matrix <- cor(cor_vars, use = “pairwise.complete.obs”)

library(ggcorrplot)

ggcorrplot(cor_matrix, method = “circle”, type = “lower”, lab = TRUE, colors = c(“red”, “white”, “blue”), title = “Correlation Matrix”

##Votetsai linearmdl<- lm(votetsai ~ female + age + DPP + income + edu + Taiwanese + Econ_worse, data = TEDS_2016) print(linearmdl) library(ggplot2)

model <- lm(votetsai ~ female + age + DPP + income + edu + Taiwanese + Econ_worse, data = TEDS_2016) summary(model)

Create a dataframe of predictions

TEDS_2016$predicted_votetsai <- predict(model)

ggplot(TEDS_2016, aes(x = predicted_votetsai, y = votetsai)) +

geom_point(alpha = 0.5) + # Scatter plot

geom_smooth(method = “lm”, color = “blue”) + # Regression line

xlab(“Predicted Votetsai”) +

ylab(“Actual Votetsai”) +

ggtitle(“Linear Regression Predictions: Votetsai”)

Tondu frequency table

TEDS_2016\(Tondu<-as.numeric(TEDS_2016\)Tondu,labels=c(“Unification now”, “Status quo, unif. in future”, “Status quo, decide later”, “Status quo forever”, “Status quo, indep. in future”, “Independence now”, “No response”))

frequency_table<- table(TEDS_2016$Tondu) print(frequency_table)
